Importance of Indoor Air Quality

Both short- and long-term exposure to indoor air pollution can cause a range of health issues, including respiratory diseases, heart disease, cognitive deficits, and cancer.

To improve indoor air quality, maintain regular cleaning and proper ventilation. Air purifiers and filters can also help remove pollutants from the air inside buildings. Additionally, monitor and control the humidity levels, as high humidity levels can lead to the growth of mold and other fungi, while low humidity levels can cause dry skin and respiratory problems.
